page.title: 15The Station at Tring
page.content: In 1837 a large number of people in Tring sent a petition to the London and Birmingham Railway Company.They wanted their station to be built at Pendley, not Pitstone Green. William Kay, the owner of Tring Park and of Silk Mill where 600 people worked, said that he would send all his goods by train if they would do as the deputation asked.The company replied that they would do so ,if the people of Tring would themselves help to buy the land for the station. Tring station was designed by George Aitcheson and built by W.L Cubitt(the main contractors of the line from Kings Langley to Tring)it was,after all,easier to run the railway line from the town-and cheaper.The present position of the station makes it inconvenient for today's commuter being 1 mile from the town centre.
